title.narrative: Linking potato producers union in a sustainable way to processing factory

description.narrative:
In the Kisoro area the potato is one of the major crops. A new factory (Kisoro Potato Processing Industries Ltd) has been built by a Ugandan investor, supported by funding from the Netherlands embassy. They will process potatoes into frozen french fries. For this purpose Kisoro District Potato Growers Co-Operative Union has been created; a union of 12 cooperatives of potato growers in the district. A Memorandum of Understanding has already been signed between the union and the factory. The biggest challenge is the production of suitable varieties.
The Union and the factory have got a future. But to reach this, they need proper seed, of varieties with processing qualities because none of the traditional varieties are suitable for processing. Yield will increase by using suitable new and certified varieties.
Furthermore the farmers need training on cultivation, storage etc. The availability of warehouses is important for the factory for continuation of the process. IFDC has already done a great job with improving roads, but there are still parts in the Kisoro area which are difficult to reach, especially in the wet season.
The Union needs official board members and there is a special need to bring technical members on the board. The administration of the cooperatives will become even more important when the factory starts processing.
Agriterra will support the Union with their organization, and will support a lot of small farmers in a typical potato area. There is a lot of potential in this Union and in this region.
Setting up the union Training in cooperative management Setting up a management team
